name: Smoked Pork Butt Breakfast Burritos
description: Breakfast burritos packed with smoked pulled pork, crispy potatoes, scrambled eggs, smoked onions, and salsa verde. Instructions included for optional cheese.

ingredients.name: Bone-in Pork Butt
ingredients.notes: Yields ~2.5 lbs shredded pork needed for 5 servings

ingredients.name: Pork Skin/Fat Trimmings
ingredients.notes: Reserved from pork butt for cracklings

ingredients.name: Shredded Cheddar/Mexican Cheese
ingredients.notes: Approx 1.75 cups. Only use if making with cheese.

instructions: Smoked Pork Butt: Trim pork butt, rub with mustard (optional) and dry spices. Smoke at 250°F for ~1.5-2 hours per pound (total ~3-4 hrs for 1.5lb) until 195-205°F internal. Rest 1 hour, then shred. Reserve fatty trimmings for cracklings.
Smoked Onions: Toss onion wedges/rings with olive oil, salt, pepper. Smoke at 250°F for 1-2 hours until tender. Cool and chop.
Smoked Salsa Verde: Smoke tomatillos, jalapeños, halved onion, garlic at 250°F for 1 hour until soft. Blend with cilantro, lime juice, salt.
Crispy Pork Cracklings: Increase smoker/oven to 400°F. Cook reserved trimmings until crispy (15-25 min). Cool and chop fine.
Potatoes: Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet. Add diced potatoes, season with salt, pepper, chili powder. Cook until golden and tender (~20-25 min).
Eggs: Melt butter in skillet. Scramble eggs with salt/pepper until fluffy. Set aside.
Assembly (Makes 10 Burritos): Warm tortillas. For each burrito, layer ~4 oz pork, ~2 oz potatoes, 1 scrambled egg, ~0.3 oz smoked onions, ~1 tsp salsa verde, sprinkle of cracklings.
Assembly (With Cheese): *Before folding*, add ~0.7 oz (just under 1/4 cup) shredded cheese on top of fillings.
Assembly (Folding): Fold bottom edge up, then fold sides inward, then roll tightly.
cookNotes: Original recipe made 44 burritos (22 servings), including a variation for 10 burritos without cheese.
Smoking times are estimates for the scaled-down pork butt.
